alert.note: Alert for Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 09 at 5:00PM CST until December 09 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...TORNADO EMERGENCY FOR GALLATIN AND HENDERSONVILLE... ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CST FOR SOUTHERN SUMNER AND NORTHWESTERN WILSON COUNTIES... At 459 PM CST, a confirmed large and destructive tornado was located near Hendersonville, or near Gallatin, moving east at 40 mph. TORNADO EMERGENCY for Gallatin and Hendersonville. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Deadly tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. The tornado will be near... Gallatin around 505 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Bledsoe Creek State Park, Cottontown, and Green Hill. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 98 and 102. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous, and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If in a mobile home, a vehicle or outdoors, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
